comment.author: 25453448@N02
comment._content: This pre-dates the Aberystwyth Cliff Railway (Rheilfordd y Graig) (built in 1896), a funicular railway which goes up Constitution Hill ('Consti') on the headland at the far end of Victoria Terrace (the row of sea-front houses). But apart from some later quarrying into the hillside near where the railway is now, and of course the bathing machine and the people in the foreground, this scene has scarcely changed. Compare it with a similar shot used on the Cliff Railway website (www.aberystwythcliffrailway.co.uk/).

comment.author: 41087279@N00
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/41087279@N00/4133472032/in/photolist-7ig8eb]
Apart from the Cliff Railway not a lot had changed by 1962
